Hi Gordon,
=C2=A0
We=C2=A0want to know all the out-going links and in-comin=
g links for each page,=C2=A0and in the example, for aol.com, aolhealth.com =
is an out-going link for aol.com, and drugchecker.aolhealth.com is an in-co=
ming link for aol.com. If the link from drugchecker.aolhealth.com=C2=A0to a=
ol.com does=C2=A0not show up, we will not get all the in-coming links for a=
ol.com. Is there any way to=C2=A0retrieve that link? Can any configuration =
setting in=C2=A0the crawl=C2=A0get round that?
=C2=A0
Thanks!
Yang=C2=A0

On 2/28/11 10:20 AM, y195322 wrote:
> Hi!We are doing web c=
rawling using Heritrix, and found one issue in that once a link has been 'd=
iscovered,' it won't be 'rediscovered.'=C2=A0 This means that if we have so=
mething like:
>=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0aol.com->aolhealth.com
>=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=
aolhealth.com->drugchecker.aolhealth.com
>
> and if drugchecker.aolhealth.c=
om links to aol.com, that link will not show up in the file.
>
> Is there a=
ny way to fix this problem? Thanks!

Usually a single snapshot crawl only w=
ants to retrieve each URL once, so 
this is by-design, rather than a proble=
m.

Why do you want to fetch aol.com twice in a single crawl? (Or am I 
mis=
understanding?)

- Gordon @ IA
